snippet.textDisplay: I miss playing skyrim
snippet.textOriginal: I miss playing skyrim

snippet.textDisplay:
So sad that the game itself didn't live up to its music. A lot of bland and anticlimactic questlines, seemingly fewer side-quests than Oblivion, but we did have a lot of 'radiant AI' bullshit where you could do the same 'kill bandit' quest over and over. Only this time he's in a different dungeon! Well... different... I mean one that has the same puzzles and Draugr and no interesting loot. Have fun! Oh, and no magic crafting for you... or class building.

The environments (the ones including foliage anyway) looked like a green soup with a lot of brown tints. Even fire seemed rather pallid. It's like a dull filter was laid over the screen compared to Oblivion, and the environments weren't very varied. Many places looked too much alike. 

It just felt like Skyrim was to Oblivion what Fallout 4 was to Fallout 3. Less depth, more 'polished' and shiny. And it's not like Oblivion was deep either. The music saved what it could save.
snippet.textOriginal:
So sad that the game itself didn't live up to its music. A lot of bland and anticlimactic questlines, seemingly fewer side-quests than Oblivion, but we did have a lot of 'radiant AI' bullshit where you could do the same 'kill bandit' quest over and over. Only this time he's in a different dungeon! Well... different... I mean one that has the same puzzles and Draugr and no interesting loot. Have fun! Oh, and no magic crafting for you... or class building.

The environments (the ones including foliage anyway) looked like a green soup with a lot of brown tints. Even fire seemed rather pallid. It's like a dull filter was laid over the screen compared to Oblivion, and the environments weren't very varied. Many places looked too much alike. 

It just felt like Skyrim was to Oblivion what Fallout 4 was to Fallout 3. Less depth, more 'polished' and shiny. And it's not like Oblivion was deep either. The music saved what it could save.

snippet.textDisplay:
Skyrim, I must admit, it's kind of legendary game. Not for the plot, wich is a must just for Jrpgs, but it can give you strong emotions while exploring the region, from the cities to the wild enviroment! And when a game has locations like the mages' college or the Blackreach (!!!!) you can't do anything but say: "OMG this game IS epicness"
sorry for my english but I'm italian and I'm only 16 :')

snippet.textDisplay: Hey SupraDarky, I listened to your playlist while in my undergrad about 2 years ago. I hadn't listened for a long time, and recently started work as a game tester when I saw one of your videos pop up. I went through all 1304 videos (+your original album) over the past 3 weeks while testing (though not while testing for audio bugs!). Thanks for curating such a great list. The music you've chosen has made me interested in many games I love now; Ace Combat, Shatter, SotN to name a few. Thank you!
snippet.textOriginal: Hey SupraDarky, I listened to your playlist while in my undergrad about 2 years ago. I hadn't listened for a long time, and recently started work as a game tester when I saw one of your videos pop up. I went through all 1304 videos (+your original album) over the past 3 weeks while testing (though not while testing for audio bugs!). Thanks for curating such a great list. The music you've chosen has made me interested in many games I love now; Ace Combat, Shatter, SotN to name a few. Thank you!

snippet.textDisplay: Do it. You won't regret it. I played Morrowind and Oblivion and although both games where great gaming experiences, which I'll likely never forget, I have to say that none of them captured me as Skyrim. Hell, from time to time I get so immersed that I catch myself taking screenshots of the beautiful scenery :) Not to mention the great story, fights and dungeons ;)
snippet.textOriginal: Do it. You won't regret it. I played Morrowind and Oblivion and although both games where great gaming experiences, which I'll likely never forget, I have to say that none of them captured me as Skyrim. Hell, from time to time I get so immersed that I catch myself taking screenshots of the beautiful scenery :) Not to mention the great story, fights and dungeons ;)

snippet.textDisplay: Jeremy Soule nailing another atmospheric theme that just makes you want to get lost in the game's world. I haven't played this game much actually, only a couple hours. Someday, for sure.
